{"id":1407503091,"question_id":3444,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4 months, 1 week","timestamp":1727726556,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"1316 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1407503091/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Find the Number of Good Pairs II","memory":"195.1 MB","code":"/*\nYou are given 2 integer arrays nums1 and nums2 of lengths n and m respectively. You are also given a positive integer k.\nA pair (i, j) is called good if nums1[i] is divisible by nums2[j] * k (0 <= i <= n - 1, 0 <= j <= m - 1).\nReturn the total number of good pairs.\nConstraints:\n\n1 <= n, m <= 105\n1 <= nums1[i], nums2[j] <= 106\n1 <= k <= 103\n*/\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    long long numberOfPairs(vector<int>& nums1, vector<int>& nums2, int k) {\n        unordered_map<int, int> mp;\n        for(auto number: nums1) {\n            for(int i=1; i*i<=number; i++) {\n                if(i*i == number) {\n                    mp[i]++;\n                } else if(number % i == 0) {\n                    mp[i]++;\n                    mp[number/i]++;\n                }\n            }\n        }\n\n        long long ans = 0;\n        for(auto number: nums2) {\n            number *= k;\n            if( mp[number] > 0) \n                ans += mp[number];\n        };\n        return ans;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"find-the-number-of-good-pairs-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
